Title: CFX/CMS - IMS (IP Multimedia Subsystem) Delta from 17.0 to 17.5 SP4/18.0
Audience: Target audience - Nokia personnel who need to deploy, operate or maintain IMS 17.5 SP4/18.0 features.
Description:
This is a recording of the pilot session of CN37510-V-175 CFX/CMS IMS Delta fro 17.0 to 17.5 SP4/18.0. It  covers the release differences between CFX-5000 (IMS) 17.5 and 17.5 SP4/18.0. Since 17.5 SP4 features are the majority of the user-impacted features of 18.0, this course is applicable to 17.5 SP4 and 18.0.

Contents

Nokia CFX5-000 Delta

  • Describe the differences between IMS 17.5 and 17.5 SP4/18.0 for the CFX-5000

Deploying Applications

  • Describe how the process to deploy the CSCF has changed
Objectives:
Upon completion of these materials, the student will be able to:

• describe the features of IMS 17.5 SP4/18.0

• explain the configuration of IMS 17.5 SP4/18.0 features

• explain operational differences from IMS 17.5 to 17.5 SP4/18.0
Prerequisites: Experience operating CFX-5000 and CMS-8200

Title: Recommended Standards Based Learning
Description: Learning provided by external vendors is strongly recommended for mastering the cable solution environment

Title: SCTE - Broadband Distribution Fundamentals
Audience: SCTE Provided Education
Description: The certification course provided by SCTE provides background and base knowledge into the broadband environment. This course is outside Nokia, therefore the student will have to arrange for payment outside of NokiaEDU.
Objectives:
Module 01 Distribution System Architecture

Describe the history of broadband Hybrid Fiber Coax (HFC) networks

Understand conventional coaxial CATV networks

Define HFC architecture

Recognize the symbols used in HFC design

List the types of system maps

Module 02 Introduction to Electronic Theory (AC)

The electrical concept of resistance

How resistance is related to voltage and current

How to calculate power dissipation in a resistive circuit

How to cascade multiple resistive circuits

Module 03 AC Waveforms

Explain the difference between AC and DC signals

Understand the units used to measure AC signals

Understand the time domain representations of AC signals

Identify sources of AC signals and sources of DC signals

Module 04 Resistive Circuits

Explain the electrical concept of resistance

Show how resistance is related to voltage and current

Solve series resistance circuits

Solve parallel resistance circuits

Explain constant current sinks

Module 05 Inductance and Transformers

Describe the relationship between electric current and magnetic fields

Recognize inductors and energy storage in magnetic fields

Describe magnetic cores and permeability

Describe mutual inductance

Describe the construction and operation of transformers

Module 06 Introduction to Capacitance

Understand the concept of an Electric Field

Understand a capacitor and the storage of charge

List the functions of dielectric materials

Describe capacitor construction

Module 07 Introduction to Reactance

Understand the basic concept of reactance

Calculate inductive reactance and capacitive reactance

Module 08 Coaxial Cable

Discuss the operational characteristics of coaxial cable

Understand 75-ohm characteristic impedance

Discuss the relationship between power transfer and impedance

Calculate signal attenuation levels

Explain how environmental factors affect cable

Module 09 Coaxial Cable Connectorization

Explain the use and function of coaxial cable preparation tools used in the HFC network

Identify the types of connectors used in the HFC network.

Describe connectorization in the HFC network.

Perform Hardline Coax Connectorization and Splicing

Module 10 Distribution System Passive Devices

Explain the use and function of passive devices used in the HFC network.

Explain the placement of these passive devices, particularly taps, that drive the overall network design and operation

Module 11 Distribution System Active Devices

List the active devices used in an HFC Network

Explain the function of the active devices

Name the basic functional blocks inside these active devices

Module 12 Introduction to Amplifier Operation

Describe basic HFC architecture

Describe the parts of a typical amplifier block diagram

Explain the use of Equalizers

Explain the use of variable cable compensators

Describe intermodulation distortion

Describe thermal noise and amplifier noise figure

Measure and record power in an access network

Perform a capture of forward sweep reference

Module 13 Powering a Coaxial or HFC System

List the equipment used to power coaxial and HFC networks

Describe the difference between non-standby and standby power supplies

Describe the function of line power inserters

Explain the difference between centralized and distributed powering

List the advantages and disadvantages of 60-volt and 90-volt powering

Module 14 Amplifier Electronic Components

Describe the operation of basic electronic circuit elements found in amplifiers like power supplies, baluns, filters, diplexers, fuses, pads and equalizers.

Describe basic semiconductor operation via the pn junction

List the names and types of basic semiconductor components in amplifiers

Describe what an operational amplifier is and its basic use and operation

Use Components of an RF amplifier Block Diagram to Restore Service

Module 15 Digital Signal Analyzers

Describe the uses of digital signal analyzers

List basic care and set-up procedures

Describe RF level measurements

Describe Constellation measurements

Explain ingress measurements

Module 16 TDR operation

List the effects of reflections

List several causes for reflections in a coaxial network

Describe the uses of time domain reflectometers

Describe the TDR display

Explain the importance of velocity of propagation

Module 17 Signal Leakage Measurements

List the symptoms of signal leakage

Describe the operation of signal leakage detectors

Describe the method of patrolling for signal leakage

Define CLI and its importance

List the annual CLI rules

Module 18 Network Architecture

Describe the history of broadband HFC networks

Understand conventional coaxial CATV networks

Define Hybrid Fiber Coax architecture

Explain regional broadband networks and ring architectures

Describe long distance network architectures

Module 19 Preventive Maintenance Programs

List the types of system maps and their use in system maintenance

Describe the types of downstream sweeps

Describe upstream sweep systems

Explain how leakage measurements can be used to predict system problems

Describe how cable modem telemetry can be used as a tool for maintenance

Title: SCTE - Understanding Cable Technology
Description:
An external course provided by SCTE. The student will have to arrange payment with SCTE at the time of enrollment. 

Understanding the technologies supporting today's cable telecommunications architecture is critical to making informed business decisions, thus maximizing an organization's potential. In addition to learning about the core hybrid fiber-coaxial (HFC) and fiber to the x (FTTx) architecture, participants will learn about the technologies used to deliver high-speed data (HSD), video services, voice over IP (VoIP) telephony, and networking the customer premises. The course will then explore how to hold it all together with business and operations support systems (B/OSS). In the conclusion learners will get a glimpse of cable's future.
Objectives:
Upon completion of this interactive course, learners will be able to:

Describe, in general terms, the network associated with simultaneously delivering analog/digital video, VoD, HSD, and VoIP services

Discuss, in general terms, the technologies associated with delivery of cable's "Big Three," video, voice and data

Discuss today's HFC and tomorrow's FTTx network

Define coaxial cable, fiber, frequency, megahertz (MHz), bandwidth, and channel capacity and other radio frequency (RF) properties

Explore fiber cable, wavelength and optical bandwidth, along with wave division multiplexing (WDM) technology

Explain analog and digital signals along with the differences between them

Identify the scanning methods used for video signals

Explore the distribution, compression, modulation and multiplexing of cable signals

Explain the components that are part of the video, data and voice services

Explore the customer premises home network

Explain the ways home networks are designed to deliver cable services

Describe the technologies that work on top of the home network

Define and explain the purpose of a well-defined B/OSS

Title: Handbook of Research on End-to-End Cloud Computing Architecture Design
Description:
Ideal for programmers, IT professionals, students, researchers, and engineers, this comprehensive publication provides architectural design and implementation studies on cloud computing from an end-to-end approach.

Cloud computing has become integrated into all sectors, from business to quotidian life. Since it has revolutionized modern computing, there is a need for updated research related to the architecture and frameworks necessary to maintain its efficiency.

The Handbook of Research on End-to-End Cloud Computing Architecture Design provides architectural design and implementation studies on cloud computing from an end-to-end approach, including the latest industrial works and extensive research studies of cloud computing. 

This handbook enumerates deep dive and systemic studies of cloud computing from architecture to implementation. This book is a comprehensive publication ideal for programmers, IT professionals, students, researchers, and engineers.

Title: Panorama
Description: Panorama is Nokia’s flagship development program with 20 years of heritage. It has three 5 day global modules (Silicon Valley, Asia and Europe) focusing on corporate strategy and leadership. The program is targeted for Nokia senior executive leaders, primarily leaders from the top 150 but also top talent from lower levels JG13+. The program is sponsored by Rajeev Suri.
Objectives: This program is designed to build and strengthen an aligned corporate level leadership community. Instill a sense of ownership for Nokia’s future and engage executives in new strategic & leadership perspectives that accelerates their skill development.
Prerequisites: This is a nomination program for senior executive leaders

Title: Excentis - Introduction to HFC Networks
Description:
The Hybrid-Fibre-Coax (HFC) architecture has been adapted by the majority of cable operators for internet, telephony and multimedia services. Understanding the performance of the individual components in an HFC network is important to estimate their impact on the communication signals in the return path (from customer to headend).

The course gives an introduction to the architecture and the basic components of the return path of an HFC network. Beside this, the attendee will get insight in the different sources of interference, their influence on the communication signals, and some appropriate mitigation techniques.
Objectives:
Understand the architecture of an HFC network.

Knowledge of the performance of basic components in the return path of an HFC network.

Understanding of the sources of interference and of the techniques to reduce the interference.

Title: Excentis - DOCSIS 3.1 Essentials
Audience: Excentis - DOCSIS 3.1 Essentials
Description: DOCSIS 3.1 is the latest version of the DOCSIS set of specifications, promising download speeds of up to 10 Gbps. It defines a totally new physical layer for achieving those speeds.
Objectives:
A quick and dense overview of the technological evolution and its advantages along with the basic concepts introduced in DOCSIS 3.1.

An overview of the different features and characteristics without providing the exact mechanisms

Understanding of the speeds that can be offered by 3.1 based on network parameters

After attending this course the attendee will be capable of understanding the essential DOCSIS 3.1 concepts

Title: Excentis - Introduction to EuroPacketCable
Audience: Excentis - Introduction to EuroPacketCable
Description:
The EuroPacketCable technology provides a European cable operator with a system that enables packet-based telephony over IP.

The course introduces the attendee to all elements of the EuroPacketCable system for VoIP deployment; this goes from an overview of the different interfaces and components, the key issues concerning security and the MTA’s provisioning process, over call signaling and control, dynamic QoS and the back office, to the V5.2 gateway solution.
Objectives:
Understand the EuroPacketCable architecture.

Gain an insight in the security, protocols and quality of service used in EuroPacketCable.

Have a clear understanding of the different call flows.

Benefit from the hands-on experience of the Excentis’ EuroPacketCable certification testing.

Title: Excentis - (Euro)DOCSIS Technology and Protocols
Audience: Excentis - (Euro)DOCSIS Technology and Protocols
Description: The (Euro)DOCSIS technology is the leading technology for broadband IP access in cable networks. The (Euro)DOCSIS cable networks are also the basis for all next generation packet-based services like VoIP, video conferencing and other high-speed multimedia services. The Level 1 training comprehensively covers all aspects of the (Euro)DOCSIS technology up to DOCSIS 3.1. Hereby the fundamentals of the architecture, the cable modem’s provisioning process, security issues and their solutions, quality of service, management and much more are explained. This being an excellent starting point for people new to the real technical subjects and protocol level within (Euro)DOCSIS.
Objectives:
Achieve a comprehensive understanding of the ideas behind the (Euro)DOCSIS specifications up to DOCSIS 3.1.

Understand the most important key issues and advantages when using (Euro)DOCSIS in your cable network.

Benefit from the hands-on experience of the Excentis’ EuroDOCSIS certification testing.

After attending this course the attendee will be capable of understanding the (Euro)DOCSIS reference model and concepts.

Title: IT Communications Toolbox
Audience: This toolbox is targeted for employees involved in communications related to IT services or projects, or supporting the IT organization in unit internal communications.
Description:
IT Communications Toolbox - the shared library of communication guidance and templates, process descriptions, tool and channel instructions as well as best practice sharing. 

Whether involved in communications related to IT services or projects or supporting the IT organization in unit internal communications, this site provides you everything you need for producing high-quality, harmonized communications deliverables.

Title: Tomi Juvonen Blog
Audience:
Tomi Juvonen

Senior SW Architect, Nokia
Description:
Hi,

I have been working in the Telco industry since 1998. Watching the industry to evolve and being part of making it happen.

2014 I started to work in the OPNFV to make Telco/NFV features to open source. My main focus is to drive changes into OpenStack . Figure out with developers, operators and OPNFV community of how things can be done to satisfy Telco and other users needs. Discuss, communicate and do the code.

Now making this blog as some ideas are good to be expressed here.

Br,

Tomi Juvonen

The contents are very much useful for anyone who are interested in Nokia's GS project management methodology, processes, and tools related to scope, schedule, budget, and quality requirements.

.
More information: Participants can claim 3.75 PDUs (Use the Technical category of the Talent Triangle) for PMP Renewal

Title: Eficode - DevOps Introduction for DevOps Champions
Description:
This virtual training introduces DevOps and discusses Agile, DevOps and Cloud

Introduction to Agile

  • What is Agile software development?
  • The Manifesto for Agile Software Development
  • Waterfall model
  • Benefits and Risks of implementing Agile way of working
  • Software development methods/processes (e.g. Scrum: Sprint, Retrospective; XP, DSDM, FDD)
  • Requirements Management ○ User stories, story points, burndown charts
  • Why choose Agile?, why choose DevOps?

Introduction to DevOps

  • A new paradigm for cultural transformation?
  • What is DevOps?
  • How to lead change in organizations to adopt DevOps best practices
  • From Waterfall to Agile to DevOps: culture, technology, change leadership
  • DevOps’ core values: CAMS (culture, automation, measurement and sharing)
  • Empowerment of teams
  •  - Cross-functional self-organizing teams
  •  - Experimentation mindset (plan, do, check, act)
  •  - Servant leadership
  •  - Breaking down silos
  •  - Soft skills, interpersonal communication

Devops (technical aspect)

  • Typical concepts and terms used in DevOps (e.g. VM, microservices, containers, orchestration, …)
  • Benefits and Risks of implementing DevOps way of working
  • Automation tools: What is infrastructure automation (Terraform, Ansible, CloudFormation, …)?
  • What is Continuous Integration (CI)? What is Continuous Delivery (CD)? Typical tools used within infrastructure automation, CI and CD

DevOps and the Cloud

  • Traditional solution model (On-premise: bare metal)
  • Public, Private, Hybrid cloud (Amazon AWS, Microsoft Azure, Eucalyptus, OpenStack)
  • IaaS, PaaS, SaaS, Serverless computing
  • Telecom Cloud Basics

Industry case examples

  • DevOps in Facebook, Uber, Airbnb, Amazon
  • Delivery times, performance, outages, automation
  • DevOps in Telco model vs. in other industry segments
Objectives:
After completing this training participants will be able to:

  • support DevOps Pilots as DevOps Champions
  • act as evangelists for DevOps

Title: Communication, Collaboration and Coaching for Leaders
Description:
This program is aimed at First line Leaders, Project Leaders and anyone leading a team.

This program will enable participants to become an effective leader. It will introduce and explore the tools and skills that are necessary to lead, communicate, collaborate and coach in the business eco-system. This is a highly interactive and experiential program, with a work based assignment to support implementation.

PLEASE NOTE: You need to have completed 'Introduction to Coaching at Nokia' before you register for this program.
Objectives:
On completion of this two day program, learners will be able to:

•Communicate high level messages to teams and networks with clarity

•Use verbal and non-verbal communication more effectively

•Identify, manage and resolve a challenging situation with confidence

•Build stronger, trust-based relationships

•Collaborate under pressure and enhance team working

•Become more influential without authority

•Use coaching as a communication skill and performance dialogue

•Use the GROW model to navigate the coaching conversation

•Use the AID model to give and receive meaningful feedback
Prerequisites: Introduction to Coaching at Nokia WBT

Title: Agile Leaders
Audience: The AGILE LEADERS learning series aims at setting the framework and providing the necessary inspiration for becoming agile leaders, prepared to implement the change and lead an agile organization.
Description:
Agile organizations are evolving organizations that know no boundaries and are on a journey to greater heights that never ends. They are not created by design but by evolution.

Leading this new business environment requires the capability to sense and respond to changes with actions that are focused, fast and flexible. The best way to put it: next generation leaders are agile.

But agile environments tend to be radically different from the environments they replace and…it’s going to hurt.

The AGILE LEADERS learning series is built of three short SWAY online modules: 

  •    Agile Ready Leaders (15min)
  •    Agile Change Management (30min)
  •    Agile - This is going to hurt! (15min)

#AGILE
Objectives:
By completing the curriculum you will:

• learn what agile leaders look like 

• explore the basic Agile tenets to follow to become agile ready leaders and agile's biggest derailers

• the principles and attributes of agile organizations

• learn how to implement the change for an organization to become agile

• learn how agile ready leaders can overcome resistance when moving their organization to become Agile

• understand what's in it for you when becoming an agile leader

Title: Agile Introductory Training for GS
Description:

Title: Agile Organization
Description:
Agile organizations are evolving organizations that know no boundaries and are on a journey to greater heights that never ends. They are not created by design but by evolution. It’s about a shift in the company’s culture and Nokia Way principles show very well the direction to be taken.

This collection provides learning options to deliver a "jump start" in an agile environment and targets to bring an agile spirit within Nokia at all levels - individuals, leaders, teams and organization level.

‘AGILE SPIRIT’ learning path is about individual agility, collective agile mindset and about agile people, offering also a preview of agile leaders, teams and organizations. It covers implicitly the soft skills for an agile Project Manager (drop the A from Agile... or not) but it is NOT about Agile Project Management practices.

[NEW Feb 2018] ‘AGILE LEADERS’ learning series aims at setting the framework and providing the necessary inspiration for becoming agile leaders, prepared to implement the change and lead an agile organization. 

[NEW April 2018] ‘AGILE – DECENTRALIZE DECISION MAKING AND EMPOWERING INDIVIDUALS’ learning module will help you understand how individuals get empowered and how the leaders empower their organization to make own decisions. 

[TO COME May 2018] ‘AGILE TEAMS’ 

#AGILE

Title: Agile Principles & Methodologies
Description:
Agile projects use of short work iterations and incremental development of products that focus on business priorities and customer value. In this course, you'll learn fundamental Agile concepts, including the eight Agile values and twelve Agile principles. This course also covers the five phases of the Agile project management model, and introduces you to the most common Agile methodologies and frameworks. 

Finally, this course introduces key activities for managing an Agile project, including creating a product vision and project charter, and best contract and documentation types. This course is one of a series in the Skillsoft learning path that covers the objectives for the PMI Agile Certified Practitioner (PMI-ACP)® exam. PMI-ACP is a registered mark of the Project Management Institute, Inc.
Prerequisites: None

Title: TED Talk: 10 ways to have a better conversation by Celeste Headlee
Audience: TED Talks are influential videos from expert speakers on education, business, science, tech and creativity.
Description:
When your job hinges on how well you talk to people, you learn a lot about how to have conversations -- and that most of us don't converse very well.

Celeste Headlee has worked as a radio host for decades, and she knows the ingredients of a great conversation: Honesty, brevity, clarity and a healthy amount of listening. In this insightful talk, she shares 10 useful rules for having better conversations. "Go out, talk to people, listen to people," she says. "And, most importantly, be prepared to be amazed."

The talk was presented on 2015.
More information: Visit NokiaEDU TED Talk library to find inspiring presentations of various topics.

Cette collection de eLearning a pour objectif la sensibilisation à l'accessibilité numérique. Ces formations en ligne ont été développées en partenariat avec Nokia, l’association BrailleNet et l’Université Paris-Saclay pour soutenir le développement de l’accessibilité numérique tant en entreprise qu’en université.

  • Vidéo d'introduction

Title: Awareness to e-accessibility
Audience: All employees
Description: The aim of this e-learning module is to make you aware of the various difficulties faced by disabled people. This e-learning module has been produced in partnership with Nokia, the BrailleNet association and the University of Paris-Saclay.
Objectives: At the end of this module, you will understand that e-accessibility is a necessity nowadays for the professional integration of disabled people.

Title: Sensibilisation à l'accessibilité numérique [FR]
Audience: Tous les employés
Description: Ce module e-learning a pour but de vous sensibiliser aux nombreuses difficultés auxquelles sont confrontées les personnes en situation de handicap.
Objectives: Vous comprendrez à travers ce module que l’accessibilité numérique est aujourd’hui une nécessité pour l’insertion professionnelle des personnes handicapées.

Title: How to Create Accessible Documents Using Microsoft Word
Audience: All employees
Description:
This course is divided into two parts. The ‘Best Practices Guide’ gives users an in-depth presentation of the skills and concepts needed to create accessible documents using Microsoft Word. 

The ‘Accessible Word Document Tutorial’ reviews the best practices and procedures covered in the ‘Best Practices Guide.’ If you’re taking this course for the first time, you are strongly encouraged to start with the ‘Best Practices Guide.’ You can always refer back to the ‘Accessible Word Document Tutorial’’ section whenever needed in the future. 

A review of all the practices and procedures covered is also available as a downloadable PDF.

Title: Créer des documents accessibles avec Microsoft Word [FR]
Description:
Ce module vous permettra de découvrir les bonnes pratiques pour créer des documents Word accessible. En effet de plus en plus d’utilisateurs sont amenés à se servir de technologies d'assistance pour surmonter des barrières à l’accès aux contenus bureautiques ou web. Suivre ces bonnes pratiques rends les documents compatible avec des aides logicielles ou matérielles, mais les rends également plus facile à manipuler par tous les utilisateurs. On a donc tous a y gagner.

Les procédures décrites dans ce document sont valables à partir de Word 2013.

Title: The Agility Shift: Creating AGILE and Effective Leaders, Teams, and Organizations
Audience: The Agility Shift provides specific, actionable strategies and tactics for leaders at all levels of the organization to put into practice immediately to improve agility and achieve results.
Description: The Agility Shift shows business leaders exactly how to make the radical mindset and strategy shift necessary to create an agile, entrepreneurial organization that can innovate and thrive in complex, ever-changing contexts. As author Pamela Meyer explains, there is much more involved than a reconfiguration of the org chart and job descriptions. It requires relinquishing the illusion of control at the very foundation of most management training and business practice.
Objectives:
In this book, through the stories of four very different types of organizations, you will:

- discover the nature of the agility shift

- discover the five dynamics of the Agility Shift

- learn how to become an Agile Leader and build Agile Teams

- learn how to co-create an agile organization and maximize agility into the ecosystem

- learn how to shift to Agile Learning and Development and manage your Agile Talents

Regardless of your role in your organization this book will show you how to reach business goals by improving agile performance.

Title: Introduction to GS Analytics Offering

Objectives: Proficiency Level 2

Title: TED Talk: The secret structure of great talks by Nancy Duarte
Audience: TED Talks are influential videos from expert speakers on education, business, science, tech and creativity.
Description:
From the "I have a dream" speech to Steve Jobs' iPhone launch, many great talks have a common structure that helps their message resonate with listeners. In this talk, presentation expert Nancy Duarte shares practical lessons on how to make a powerful call-to-action.

The talk was presented on 2011.

Title: TED Talk: How data will transform business by Philip Evans
Audience: TED Talks are influential videos from expert speakers on education, business, science, tech and creativity.
Description:
What does the future of business look like? In an informative talk, Philip Evans gives a quick primer on two long-standing theories in strategy -- and explains why he thinks they are essentially invalid.

The talk was presented on 2013.

Title: TED Talk: TED's secret to great public speaking by Chris Anderson
Audience: TED Talks are influential videos from expert speakers on education, business, science, tech and creativity.
Description:
There's no single formula for a great talk, but there is a secret ingredient that all the best ones have in common. TED curator Chris Anderson shares this secret -- along with four ways to make it work for you. Do you have what it takes to share an idea worth spreading?

The talk was presented on 2016.

Title:
TED Talk: Why we have too few women leaders by Sheryl Sandberg
e your text
Audience: TED Talks are influential videos from expert speakers on education, business, science, tech and creativity.
Description:
Facebook COO Sheryl Sandberg looks at why a smaller percentage of women than men reach the top of their professions -- and offers 3 powerful pieces of advice to women aiming for the C-suite.

The talk was presented on 2010.

Title: TED Talk: Your body language shapes who you are by Amy Cuddy
Audience: TED Talks are influential videos from expert speakers on education, business, science, tech and creativity.
Description:
Body language affects how others see us, but it may also change how we see ourselves. Social psychologist Amy Cuddy argues that "power posing" — standing in a posture of confidence, even when we don't feel confident — can boost feelings of confidence, and might have an impact on our chances for success. NOTE: Some of the findings presented in this talk have been referenced in an ongoing debate among social scientists about robustness and reproducibility. Read "Criticisms & updates" below for more details as well as Amy Cuddy's response.

The talk was presented on 2012.

Title: TED Talk: The career advice you probably didn’t get by Susan Colantuono
Audience: TED Talks are influential videos from expert speakers on education, business, science, tech and creativity.
Description:
You’re doing everything right at work, taking all the right advice, but you’re just not moving up. Why? Susan Colantuono shares a simple, surprising piece of advice you might not have heard before quite so plainly. This talk, while aimed at an audience of women, has universal takeaways -- for men and women, new grads and midcareer workers. 

The talk was presented in 2013.

Title: TED Talk - The era of open innovation - Charles Leadbeater
Audience: TED Talks are influential videos from expert speakers on education, business, science, tech and creativity.
Description:
In this deceptively casual talk, Charles Leadbeater weaves a tight argument that innovation isn't just for professionals anymore. Passionate amateurs, using new tools, are creating products and paradigms that companies can't.

The talk was presented in 2017.

Title: TED Talk: Your elusive creative genius by Elizabeth Gilbert
Audience: TED Talks are influential videos from expert speakers on education, business, science, tech and creativity.
Description:
Elizabeth Gilbert muses on the impossible things we expect from artists and geniuses -- and shares the radical idea that, instead of the rare person "being" a genius, all of us "have" a genius. It's a funny, personal and surprisingly moving talk.

The talk was presented in 2009.

Title: TED Talk: The power of vulnerability by Brené Brown
Audience: TED Talks are influential videos from expert speakers on education, business, science, tech and creativity.
Description:
Brené Brown studies human connection -- our ability to empathize, belong, love. In a poignant, funny talk, she shares a deep insight from her research, one that sent her on a personal quest to know herself as well as to understand humanity. A talk to share.

The talk was presented in 2010.

Title: TED Talk: Embrace the remix by Kirby Ferguson
Audience: TED Talks are influential videos from expert speakers on education, business, science, tech and creativity.
Description: Nothing is original, says Kirby Ferguson, creator of Everything is a Remix. From Bob Dylan to Steve Jobs, he says our most celebrated creators borrow, steal and transform.

Title: TED Talk: Success, failure and the drive to keep creating by Elizabeth Gilbert
Audience: TED Talks are influential videos from expert speakers on education, business, science, tech and creativity.
Description:
Elizabeth Gilbert was once an "unpublished diner waitress," devastated by rejection letters. And yet, in the wake of the success of 'Eat, Pray, Love,' she found herself identifying strongly with her former self. With beautiful insight, Gilbert reflects on why success can be as disorienting as failure and offers a simple -- though hard -- way to carry on, regardless of outcomes.

The talk was published in 2014.

Title: TED Talk: How to manage for collective creativity by Linda Hill
Audience: TED Talks are influential videos from expert speakers on education, business, science, tech and creativity.
Description:
What's the secret to unlocking the creativity hidden inside your daily work, and giving every great idea a chance? Harvard professor Linda Hill, co-author of "Collective Genius," has studied some of the world's most creative companies to come up with a set of tools and tactics to keep great ideas flowing -- from everyone in the company, not just the designated "creatives."

The talk was published in 2015.

Title: TED Talk: The surprising habits of original thinkers by Adam Grant
Audience: TED Talks are influential videos from expert speakers on education, business, science, tech and creativity.
Description:
How do creative people come up with great ideas? Organizational psychologist Adam Grant studies "originals": thinkers who dream up new ideas and take action to put them into the world. In this talk, learn three unexpected habits of originals -- including embracing failure. "The greatest originals are the ones who fail the most, because they're the ones who try the most," Grant says. "You need a lot of bad ideas in order to get a few good ones."

The talk was published in 2016.

Title: TED Talk: How to speak so that people want to listen by Julian Treasure
Audience: TED Talks are influential videos from expert speakers on education, business, science, tech and creativity.
Description: Have you ever felt like you're talking, but nobody is listening? Here's Julian Treasure to help. In this useful talk, the sound expert demonstrates the how-to's of powerful speaking — from some handy vocal exercises to tips on how to speak with empathy. A talk that might help the world sound more beautiful.

Title: TED Talk: Talk Nerdy to me by Melissa Marshall
Audience: TED Talks are influential videos from expert speakers on education, business, science, tech and creativity.
Description:
Melissa Marshall brings a message to all scientists (from non-scientists): We're fascinated by what you're doing. So tell us about it -- in a way we can understand. In just 4 minutes, she shares powerful tips on presenting complex scientific ideas to a general audience.

The talk was published in 2012.

Title: TED Talks | Influential Videos
Description:
TED Talks are influential videos from expert speakers on education, business, science, tech and creativity.

TED Talks are given in the TED conferences organized throughout North America, Europe and Asia since 1984. TED Talks address a wide range of topics within the research and practice of science and culture, in the most innovating and engaging ways.

Starting 2018, NokiaEDU curates a collection of carefully selected TED Talks. Visit NokiaEDU TED Talk library to find out a list of inspiring presentations available for you! The collection is available for all Nokia employees.

Study TED Talks as a part of learning programs or as individual self-study resources via Learning & Development Hub.

Title: A3 Methodology Introduction
Audience: All employees
Description: A3 is a 'Lean' problem solving and reporting methodology which originated from the Toyota Production System. It enables Process Improvement teams to approach problem solving in a disciplined, consistent, structured and well governed way, resulting in a high probability of success. It fosters a deep understanding of the specific problem under review and is a powerful skill-building and mentorship tool. The A3 methodology can be applied to virtually any problem. It is helpful in improving defect prevention, Release software and hardware quality, as well as helping to identify ways to reduce fault backlog and outages. It provides a link to the Countermeasures for problems.
Objectives:
Explain the purpose and benefits of the A3 Methodology

Lead an A3 Project which will deliver the specified results

Act as an effective team member on an A3 Project

Measure and demonstrate the impact of an A3 Project

Deliver clear and tangible improvements

Institutionalize improvements so that results can be sustained and leveraged across the business

Title: The Fundamentals of 8D Problem Solving
Audience: Targeted for anyone that has been assigned responsibility to perform an active role in leading or supporting the 8D Structured Problem Solving method within their Line of Business. For example, this may include Business Line Heads, Quality Leaders, Line Managers, Operations Staff, Customer Operations Staff, Global Services, etc.
Description: This course introduces the concepts of 8D. What is it? When to use it?
Objectives:
At the end of this session, you will be able to:

- Summarize what 8D is

- Decide when to use 8D

- List the 8 steps

- Ask the key questions in each step

- List the key tools in each step

Description: Sergio Fasce presents the NokiaEDU 2018 objectives.
Objectives: Target audience: NokiaEDU

Title: Field Force Mode of Operation
Description:
Nokia Field Force completes hundreds of customer field service requests everyday 365 days a year – 24 hours a day with a clear focus on Right-First-Time/Safe-Every-Time delivery.  Customers worldwide have come to recognize our Nokia Field Service and Rollout Managers for their unmatched experience, expert field installation project management skills and can-do resourcefulness. 

As a “transversal” organization, Nokia Field Force manages field installations for all 4 Networking Business Groups across all 7 markets supporting all types of customers including Service Providers and the Global Enterprise & Public Sector market.  This transversal One Field Force model drives the optimization of resources in management, technicians, tools and facilities. 

Our Central Practices team is our catalyst for driving best practice sharing and implementation worldwide. They maintain a close relationship with the Global Services Delivery Excellence team to define our Mode of Operation which drives maximum efficiency. As we continue with our training on the Mode of Operation, we now focus on Project Delivery aspects.

Please note: following training is based on MoO V4.1

Title: Ask Yourself Training
Audience: Targeted to Nokia employees and sub-contractors who may have access to customer networks
Description:
Ask Yourself Training – 2018 | TTI30085W_V3.0

This course illustrates how to utilize common processes and principles in support of our customers networks to help eliminate Procedural Errors that lead to partial or full network outages
Objectives:
This course is designed to enable the student to:

-Describe why it's important to complete prerequisite work before taking action on a live customer network,

-Describe how to apply the "Ask Yourself" principles in your daily work, and

-Describe how to improve service excellence and our customers' trust when they allow us to work on their networks

Title: Nokia LTE Starter
Audience: Nokia LTE Starter
Description:
Nokia LTE starter provides an overview of the LTE radio interface, with a special emphasis on the physical layer structure and operation.

Further it provides an overview of the 3GPP Long Term Evolution / Service Architecture Evolution (LTE/SAE) end-to-end system, with a special emphasis on mobility management, connection management procedures, technology aspects, ECM-Connected state procedures and Nokia supported features.

In addition it provides an overview the current solutions for Voice, Interoperability, Charging and Location features and the transport options available within the LTE system.

It further explains the LTE Security Solutions and QoS Solutions currently supported by Nokia.

In details:

Introduction to LTE/SAE Architecture WBT

LTE Radio Interface - Physical Layer WBT

- Introduction to the LTE/SAE

- Introduction to OFDMA and SC-FDMA

- LTE Air Interface Physical Structure

- LTE Air Interface Protocol Structure

LTE Mobility - ECM-Idle

- Introduction

- Mobility Management in ECM-IDLE state

- Connection Management

- Mobility Management in ECM-CONNECTED state

- End-to-End example

LTE Mobility - ECM-Connected

- Mobility Management in ECM-CONNECTED state

- End-to-End example

LTE Blended features - Voice, Interoperability, Charging and Location

- Voice Evolution

- Interoperability between LTE and 2G/3G/3GPP2

- Charging Solutions

- Location Solutions

LTE Transport Solutions

- LTE Transport Overview

- LTE Transport Products

- Ethernet Solutions

- LTE Network Solutions

- Synchronization

LTE Security Solutions

- User Security

- Operator Security

LTE QoS Solutions

- QoS Profiling

- Admission Control

- Policy and Charging

- QoS Procedures

- Emergency Services
Duration: Minimum 1 hour, Maximum 10 hours, depending on track and your level of expertise

Title: Scrum Master Certification (SMC™) Online
Description:
This is a complete online learning and certification. 

Learners will get access for 180 days for all needed resources to apply for the exam and then they can schedule an online proctored exam and  become certified.

Learning Resources:

  • No Of Chapters: 5
  • No Of Videos: 28
  • Videos Duration: 217.38 Minutes
  • Other Resources included: Glossary, SBOK, Case Studies, Chapter Tests, Crossword, Reference Materials, Mobile app.
  • Course Validity: 180 Days
Objectives:
Scrum Master Certified (SMC™) professionals are facilitators who ensure that the Scrum Team is provided with an environment conducive to completing the project successfully. The Scrum Master guides, facilitiates, and teaches Scrum practices to everyone involved in the project; clears impediments for the team; and, ensures that Scrum processes are being followed.

Successful candidates will be awarded the Scrum Master Certified (SMC™) certification by SCRUMstudy after passing the certification exam.
Duration: 16 hours (Please note this really depends on how much time you need to study)
Prerequisites: There is no formal prerequisite for this certification. However, it is preferable to complete the Scrum Developer Certified (SDC™) certification before applying for the Scrum Master certification.
More information: No. of PDU: 16 PDUs (This certification entitles PMPs to get 16 PDU)

Title: NSW - Nokia Software Suggested Learning
Description: This set of suggested learning are build by analysing the preferences of about 1000 colleagues during the LinkedIn Learning pilot. Equivalent courses have been identified on Skillsoft Platform

Title: Making an Impact with Non-verbal Communication
Description: To our earliest ancestors, non-verbal communication was communication! The primitive parts of our brains are still wired to respond automatically when we're afraid, threatened, disgusted, surprised, or happy. But we've come a long way in our development and understanding of our brain's ability to respond and communicate in valuable, non-verbal ways. In this course, you will find out how our attitude, posture, gestures, facial expressions, and tone have great impact on our communication.

Title: Docker Introduction
Description: This course provides an introduction to containerization and Docker terminology. You'll learn how Dockerfiles are used to build Docker images and how a container is a running instance of an image.

Title: Software Practices (SCRUM): SCRUM Meetings
Description: A large part of the Scrum process revolves around the Scrum meetings. SCRUM meetings are highly structured and time efficient, and are part of the fantastic success of SCRUM methodologies. Another large piece of the Scrum process is managing user stories. User stories are short descriptions in non-technical language of how a system is expected to behave, and are one of the key and unique features of SCRUM development. This course covers the Scrum meeting and user stories in depth. It also covers key concepts, such as velocity and technical debt.

Title: FN - Fixed Network Suggested Learning
Description: This set of suggested learning are build by analysing the preferences of about 1000 colleagues during the LinkedIn Learning pilot. Equivalent courses have been identified on Skillsoft Platform

Title: Java Spring: Spring Application Basics
Description: The Spring Framework is one of the most popular application development frameworks for creating enterprise Java applications. The incorporated best practices and infrastructure support provided by the framework simplifies application buildup and breakdown, allowing developers to spend more time on business logic. In addition to the core framework, there are several active Spring Projects available to make developing specific types of applications, or implementing certain concerns in Java applications easier. In this course, you will learn the basics of the Spring Framework including setting up an environment for developing Spring applications, about Spring beans, about Spring xml configuration, and about dependency injection and autowiring using Spring.

Title: Data Science Overview
Description: Data science differentiates itself from academic statistics and application programming by using what it needs from a variety of disciplines. In this course, you'll explore what it is to be a data scientist and study what sets data science apart from other disciplines. It prepares learners to navigate the foundational elements of data science.

Title: Developing Your Reputation of Professionalism with Business Etiquette
Description: Your reputation often precedes you in any work environment. It can define your creditability, impact your career opportunities, and shape your relationships with your colleagues. Because your reputation is so important, you must proactively build a positive one if you want to succeed in your career. Developing a professional reputation takes more than simply having the right skills and talents for the job. It's about being self-aware, polite, and essentially treating those you interact with in a respectful way. This course introduces you to the basics of how to act professionally and practice proper business etiquette. It also explains how to present yourself in the work environment, including looking the part of a professional and ensuring your workspace reflects positively on you. And it looks at how to ensure your personal activities don't impact your work reputation, which is especially important in the time of far-reaching social media.

Title: Python: The Basics
Description: Python has a unique culture and community that has built up around it and that value its core philosophy, expressed as a series of aphorisms, and available at a few key presses from any Python installation. In this course, you'll learn the basics of Python and its philosophy, setting up Python, and writing a basic program with built-in data types, loops and conditionals.

Objectives: This course is designed to enable you to: - Understand the difference between an ordinary tendering process and the Smart Tendering process
Objectives: This course is designed to enable you to: - Understand the difference between an ordinary tendering process and the Smart Tendering process - Develop your Smart Tendering Mindset by understanding the Smart Tendering principles - Apply the Smart Tendering Mindset methodology in your day to day work whether this is as part of a bid team or in direct engagements with your customer - Gain a basic understanding of the tools and processes in Nokia supporting the Smart Tendering application (separate process and tool trainings are available for a deeper understanding)

Title: Listening Skills
Description: Active listening skills are time-tested tools used by professionals in a wide range of occupations to enhance their work. Psychologists, talk show hosts, or police negotiators may use active listening skills more than any other set of skills. Though you may not be counseling someone in distress, getting a celebrity to reveal their emotions, or bargaining for hostages, the principles of active listening are the same. Active listening means listening attentively to the speaker's words, meaning, intent, and emotions in an unbiased positive way. Active listening also involves creatively utilizing a blend of discrete skills that can be brought to bear in any conversation to draw out additional meaning, intent, and emotions.

Title: Presentation Skills
Description: For a presentation to be effective, it needs to have a sound structure. To ensure that your presentation has this structure, you should transform your ideas about its purpose, audience, and key points into notes and aids that will guide you. In this course, you'll learn how to write the key parts of a presentation so they're memorable and effective. You'll also learn how to select and use presentation and visual aids. Finally, you'll learn how to rehearse your presentation – a key step in building confidence for the real thing. read less. Presentation excellence can be achieved when the standard of your delivery matches the quality of your content. Having diligently prepared for your presentation, you need to make sure that your delivery is engaging, enthusiastic, composed, and confident. Presentations are an open dialogue between the presenter and the audience. So what can you do when you're faced with a difficult question? This Impact series product examines strategies for dealing with challenging questions.
Objectives: learn techniques for managing stage fright and using your voice and body language to deliver your message clearly and effectively. Finally, you'll learn about how to deal with audience questions in a Q&A session and the impact this has on your credibility

Title: Presentation Skills with Customer Focus
Description: This 2-day classroom course is based on hands-on exercises. It includes a chance for the participants to use their work-based challenges and presentations in the exercises.This course contains pre-work! Students must prepare a 10-minute presentation and present it to the participants and the trainer. Participants will work with their own presentations during the course. Target Audience: Product managers and solution sales managers who want to develop their skills to deliver customer focused presentations with impact. Learning Target To build on your existing experience as a presenter and help you acquire first-class skills that will improve your impact with customer. To become more receptive to the needs of your customer audience and better at making your points with maximum effect. To improve both your verbal and non-verbal presentation skills. To build short to-the-point and easy-to-understand message.
Objectives: This course is based on hands-on exercises (learning by doing) and will include a chance for the participants to use their work-based challenges and presentations in the exercises. Part I Understanding of the qualities of presentation which captivates audience and delivers your message in given time What is a structure of a good presentation, how it should be delivered and how to use visuals Part II How to influence your audience in a presentation How to handle challenging situation and difficult questions Use of voice, body language and words for projecting confidence and credibility How to involve your audience How to transfer good presentation into customer impact

Title: Introduction to SRAN17A

Title: L'accessibilité numérique à toutes les étapes d’un projet [FR]
Audience: Tous les employés
Description:
Cette formation permet de se sensibiliser à l'accessibilité numérique, d’identifier le rôle de chacun et de savoir comment prendre en compte l’accessibilité à son niveau et à chaque étape d’un projet numérique.

Chaque apprenant-e se construit un parcours de formation personnalisé, en fonction de son profil et des 6 modules pédagogiques disponibles.

Les séquences pédagogiques (Vidéo, mises en situation, études de cas, découvertes interactives, quiz, tutoriels), d’une durée moyenne de 18 minutes, s’intègrent facilement aux activités d’une journée.
Objectives:
La réalisation des 6 modules pédagogiques permet à l’apprenant-e d’acquérir les compétences suivantes :

  • Identifier les enjeux et les éléments-clés pour réussir la prise en compte de l’accessibilité.
  • Savoir piloter la prise en compte de l’accessibilité aux différentes étapes d’un projet numérique.
  • Connaître qualitativement les critères d’accessibilité et savoir évaluer certains d’entre eux.
  • Avoir des ordres de grandeur de coût et de complexité.
Duration: La durée de cette formation peut varier de 1h13 à 7h20 en fonction du profil de l’apprenant-e.

Title: Financial Fundamentals for Project Managers
Description: This Learning Path comprises four basic financial training modules that explain essential financial terminology and concept for Project Managers who do not have a great deal of experience and/or comfort with the financial aspects of their projects.
More information: Participants can claim 1 PDU (Use the Technical category of the Talent Triangle) for PMP Renewal

Title: TED Talk: Dare to disagree by Margaret Heffernan
Description:
Most people instinctively avoid conflict, but as Margaret Heffernan shows us, good disagreement is central to progress. She illustrates (sometimes counterintuitively) how the best partners aren’t echo chambers -- and how great research teams, relationships and businesses allow people to deeply disagree.

The talk was presented on June 2012 at TEDGlobal.

Title: TED Talk: How great leaders inspire action by Simon Sinek
Description:
Simon Sinek has a simple but powerful model for inspirational leadership -- starting with a golden circle and the question "Why?" His examples include Apple, Martin Luther King, and the Wright brothers ...

The talk was presented on November 2011 at TEDxPuge

Title: AGILE – Decentralizing decision making and empowering individuals
Audience: The goal of this module is to understand the decentralizing decision making process and its benefits, how to empower individuals and finally how agile leaders empower their organization to make own decisions.
Description:
Delivering value in the shortest sustainable lead time in an agile environment requires decentralized decision-making. This will reduce delays, improve product development flow and throughput and facilitate faster feedback and more innovative solutions.

Higher levels of empowerment are an additional, tangible benefit. But accepting the mantle of empowerment is the responsibility of each individual and team. 

Setting boundaries and defining expectations are two ways to empower individuals and encourage initiative, giving them the opportunity to gain your trust.

#AGILE
Objectives:
In this online SWAY module (30min) you will learn:

  • the actions agile leaders have to take to decentralize decision making
  • how to embed the capacity for greatness in the people and in the practices of an organization
  • how individuals are getting empowered
  • how to create an empowering environment
  • one of the lean principles "Empower team" and how leaders empower teams through their commitment, support and their own behaviors
  • where can you empower teams as you adopt agile

Title: Subscriber Data Management Fundamentals v2 curricula
Audience: Subscriber Data Management Fundamentals v2 self-study curriculum provides all users the pre-requisite SDM Nokia solutions and product knowledge.
Description:
Subscriber Data Management Fundamentals v2 Learning Path provides all users with the pre-requisite Subscriber Data Management Nokia solutions and products knowledge. Starting with Subscriber Data Management Overview v2 which covers the fundamentals of the SDM solution including the various SDM products, systems and solutions, and basic SDM architecture as well as the SDM hardware evolution. Next the SDM Profile Database v2 covers the fundamentals of the One-NDS database, basic technology, and architecture. Furthermore, SDM Mobile Applications covers the main SDM applications including NT HLR, HSS, One-EIR and One-MNP functionality and architecture.

Subscriber Data Management Overview v2

- Introduction

- Hardware Platform

SDM Profile Database v2

- One-NDS Introduction

- One-NDS Architecture

- One-NDS Administration and Management Interfaces

- SDM Applications v2

SDM Mobile Applications

- NT HLR Mobility Front-end

- HSS Mobility Application

- One-EIR Mobility Front-end

- One-MNP Mobility Front-end

- One-AAA Policy Application
Objectives:
Subscriber Data Management Overview

- explain the benefits of the SDM solution

- name the various SDM products, systems and solutions

- describe and basic SDM architecture

- recognize the SDM hardware evolution

SDM Profile Database

- explain One-NDS database concept

- describe One-NDS basic technology

- recognize One-NDS core architecture

- recognize the installation, administration, and management integration

SDM Applications

- review Mobility Front-end and Policy Applications

- define SDM applications (NT HLR, HSS, One-EIR and One-MNP, One-AAA) functionality

- recognize the main SDM applications architecture and interfaces
Duration: Minimum 3 hours, Maximum 4 hours, depending on track and your level of expertise

Title: Purple Cloud Architecture
Audience: Purple Cloud Architecture | TG00432-K-0001
Description:
Purple Cloud Architecture as part of a Be Cloud-Native Learning program focuses on Intermediate Cloud knowledge. Successful completion of Purple Cloud Architecture aligns with being certified in the intermediate concepts of Cloud, focusing in Architecture.

The curricula contains videos, and eLearning both mandatory and optional that focuses on the Architecture of the cloud. 

Purple Belt Common part is the starting point for the Purple Cloud Belt Architecture which will take 23 hours to complete depending on optional training selected. 

From there you will continue with an introduction to Nokia CloudBand: CBIS, CBAM and CBND.  The training also  provides a full review of the Nuage SDN solution, addressing vendor integrated and Greenfield customers.  Introduction to SDNet REFA (Software Defined Networking Reference Architecture) in a 24 min video with material available from your transcript as pre or post-work.

Open Compute Program (OCP), Airframe OCP and OCP summit 2017 Overview  consist of 3 parts:  First  what is OCP. second Airframe OCP is introduced and how it works. Lastly concentrating in OCP Summit: Nokia’s background with the summit and its role.

The training will also provide an Introduction of Open Platform for NFV (OPNFV), Nokia in OPNFV & OpenStack events, Open Network Automation Platform (ONAP) and Open Source Network Function Virtualization (OSNFV). Continuing with NSP (Network Services Platform) R17.3 which  provides a general information on the NSP system. You will also learn the definition of open source, the benefits and drawbacks of using open source, as well as some practical examples. 

Also covered in CBAM Templates - ETSI NFV background to VNF management as well as  Nuage Networks solution.

Target Audience:

The target audience includes LMS, ProjectM, ProgramM, ProductM ( including area product owners), JP: Specification and Architecture administration, support (including CS), research, standardization, business planning, pricing, operations, market strategy, reporting, etc.
Objectives:
You can view the objectives of each training solution by clicking at the courses listed in the learning objectives below.

In order to successfully completed this learning program the learning is required to take the following mandatory trainings.

  • Purple Cloud Belt COMMON part  - curriculum
  • CloudBand Introduction
  • Nuage SDN
  • Introduction to SDNet Reference Architecture
  • Open Compute Program (OCP), Airframe OCP and OCP summit 2017 Overview
  • Open Platform Network Function Virtualization (OPNFV) overview
  • NSP (Network Services Platform) Release 17.3 Overview
  • Introduction to NetAct

A number of optional trainings have also been suggested which can be taken based on the level of knowledge you require:

  • Open Source Software Overview
  • VNF Management
  • Nuage Network Technical overview
Duration: 32 hours  (depends on the choices of the optional items)
Testimonials: In order to complete this learning program and receive the achievement badge, please register first to the Purple Cloud Belt Architecture.  You can take the individual training modules by clicking on the text below.
More information: Owner: Pantelis Stakias – pantelis.stakias@nokia.com

Title: Purple Application
Audience: Purple Cloud Belt Application | TG00434-K-0001
Description:
Purple Cloud Application as part of Be Cloud-Native Learning program focuses on Intermediate Cloud knowledge. Successful completion of Purple Cloud Networking aligns with being certified in the intermediate concepts of Cloud, focusing in Application products.

The curricula contain videos, and eLearning both mandatory and optional that focuses on the Cloud Application.

Purple Belt Common part is the starting point for the Purple Cloud Application which will take 23 hours to complete depending on optional training selected.

NCA (Nokia Certified Associate) CloudBand is the second level of CloudBand certification. CNA certify a theoretical level of expertise on CloudBand portfolio.  First you must take NCF (Nokia Certified Foundation) CloudBand as  a mandatory prerequisite.

After successfully completing NCA certification comes an Introduction to SDNet REFA (Software Defined Networking Reference Architecture) which is a 24 min video with material available from your transcript as pre or post-work. Also covered in CBAM Templates - ETSI NFV background to VNF management.

As part of this curriculum you will have the opportunity to learn the definition of open source, the benefits and drawbacks of using open source, including some practical examples.

Lastly, you can choose to learn about Cloud RAN Introduction and Forecast 4G and 5G Architecture Perspective as well as Cloud BTS 18 Architecture.

Target audience:

• Developers and Testers of Applications:

• All SWD, I&V in Application products
Objectives:
You can view the objectives of each training solution by clicking at the courses listed in the learning objectives below.

To successfully completed this learning program, the learning is required to take the following mandatory trainings.

  • PURPLE Cloud Belt – COMMON part
  • Cloudband CNA Certification
  • Introduction to SDNet Reference Architecture
  • VNF Management

Several optional trainings have also been suggested which can be taken based on the level of knowledge you require:

  • NOKIA Cloud Security Director
  • Open Source overview
  • Cloud Ran introduction
  • cBTS18 introduction
Duration: 14 Hours  plus 55 Min (depends on the choices of the optional items)
Testimonials: In order to complete this learning program and receive the achievement badge, please register first to the Purple Cloud Application curriculum. You can take the individual training modules by clicking at the text below.
More information: Owner: Pantelis Stakias – pantelis.stakias@nokia.com

Title: POL Product Overview
Description: It provides an introduction to the Passive Optical LAN Solution. It describes what the Passive Optical LAN (POL) is, why it is needed, what the typical deployments are, and explains the Nokia Solution for POL

Title: POL Technology Overview
Description:
To provide an overview on the Passive Optical LAN addressing strategic direction, business/sales ambition, vision/mission and key directions of the products and solutions. This will cover following topics: portfolio elements, evolution strategy, market positioning, and value messaging (including highest level portfolio decisions/rationale + impact + key changes).

This training package also includes the POL Product Overview solution

Title: POL Maintenance Engineer
Description:
Designed for professionals who need to configure, operate and maintain a POL network with standard layer 2 services like for example HSI (High Speed Internet access) and typical LAN setups.

In this level we will also cover POL Video, Voice and Advanced Configurations. These cover more in depth details on how to configure STP, LAG, redundancy on the equipment. More operational data monitoring and how to configure and deploy video services, including high level debugging.

This training package also includes the POL Technology solution

Title: POL Field Maintenance Engineer
Description:
Designed for professionals who need to configure, operate and maintain a POL network with standard layer 2 services like for example HSI (High Speed Internet access) and typical LAN setups.

In this level we will also cover POL Video, Voice and Advanced Configurations. These cover more in depth details on how to configure STP, LAG, redundancy on the equipment. More operational data monitoring and how to configure and deploy video services, including high level debugging.

This training package also includes the POL Technology solution

Title: POL Network Operations Engineer
Description:
Designed for professionals who need to configure, operate and maintain a POL network with standard layer 2 services like for example HSI (High Speed Internet access) and typical LAN setups.

In this level we will also cover POL Video, Voice and Advanced Configurations. These cover more in depth details on how to configure STP, LAG, redundancy on the equipment. More operational data monitoring and how to configure and deploy video services, including high level debugging.

This training package also includes the POL Technology solution

Title: POL Commissioning Engineer
Description: Designed for professionals who need to have a good understanding of POL hardware, how to bring it into service and under network management, and be able to configure the physical access layer (GPON) for testing purposes of the fiber cabling.

Title: POL Installation Engineer
Description: Designed for professionals who need to have a good understanding of POL hardware, how to bring it into service and under network management, and be able to configure the physical access layer (GPON) for testing purposes of the fiber cabling.

To acquire high-level knowledge of access technologies including basic characteristics of fiber access. Capability of positioning the Fixed Ultra-Broadband access products in a FTTH network and understanding how these fit together. Optional courses are covering interesting technology introductions & hardware overviews, useful to continue to a higher level of expertise.

This package is including the FTTH Product Overview solution

'CNA FBA FTTH Technologies & Products' certification

Title: FTTH Product Overview
Description:
To learn the foundation of the Fixed Ultra-Broadband Access network. The courses cover the main network blocks required to operate an Access network, based on Fiber technology with an equipment and management introduction.

Nokia has established a FTTH Certification Program.

The certification level linked to the FTTH Product Overview learning is the

'CNF FBA FTTH Concepts & Portfolio' certification

Description:
