Title: Bell Labs Future X Workshop: Future X Jumpstart
Description:
We are at the dawn of a new era of human existence that will be shaped by digitization with the goal of automating much of our life and augmenting our intelligence, effectively creating time.

Operators are being challenged to look beyond their traditional strengths, in order to successfully transform and become key players in this new digital era. This will require leveraging and monetizing innovative technologies such as 5G, cloud, IP/Optical, Internet of Things and data analytics.

The Future X Jumpstart workshop provides a broad overview of the current and forthcoming breakthroughs in these technologies at both the architectural and systems levels, which forms the basis for discussion of the critical business issues that need to be considered today.

It discusses practical insights, industry trends and near-term applications relevant for the telecommunications industry. It also lightly introduces select elements from the five associated domain-focused workshops in the series.

Course Outine

The workshop includes the following chapters:

The Future X Network Vision

  • Explain the value of time: of saving and generating time.

  • Review the digital pyramid of human needs.

  • Explore the evolution of productivity gains as a result of technology evolutions.

  • Introduce the eight value vectors of Future X networks and operations.

The Market Drivers

  • Highlight the evolution of customer demand. Elaborate on current end user desires - life style shift, enriched communication, video and gaming experience.

  • Elaborate on evolving Industry desires - automation, robotics, and Industry 4.0.

  • Discuss the emerging need to connect everything and the value of cognition and context.

Services Evolution

  • Discuss the evolution of services and their impact on traffic growth and predictability.
  • Emphasize the significance of latency-critical services.
  • Explain how growing processing needs are driving new architectural requirements (the laws of physics).
  • Address hybrid and converged edge cloud services needs.

Technology Evolution

  • Explore the 100-year, 100x shift in network architecture.
  • Discuss the need for processing power at the edge, optimizing for converged edge cloud network functionality, and distributed data centers.
  • Examine the evolution of IP and Optical to a smart network fabric.
  • Emphasize the importance of security and privacy by design.

Business Evolution

  • Introduce the six megatrends in the industry.
  • Discuss the business value of cloudification.
  • Explain how to enable the zero-marginal cost strategy with emphasis on the zero-touch operation model.
  • Explore the advancement of massive scale access, converged edge cloud, smart network fabric, augmented cognition systems and digital value platforms as needed for new IoT services.

Introduction to Future X Domains

  • Massive Scale Access
  • Converged Edge Cloud
  • Smart Network Fabric 
  • Digital Value Platforms
  • Augmented Cognition Systems

Title: Bell Labs Future X Workshop: Massive Scale Access
Description:
Massive Scale Access brings together 5G wireless and leading-edge fixed technologies in providing hyper-capacity, hyper-low-latency functionality reliably and cost-effectively. Producing an explosion of possibilities, it will link people and things like never before, bridging our physical, virtual and social worlds.

Among the myriad business opportunities that can be unearthed through Massive Scale Access, there are initial questions any operator faces. “What does Massive Scale Access mean in my specific context?”, “What new services can I offer with Massive Scale Access?”, “How can I make money and build a business out of it?”

Massive Scale Access must be realized through evolution and disruptive innovations in the underlying networks and associated operations.

This workshop addresses the technology, architecture and economic pillars of the evolution to Massive Scale Access. It provides a global perspective based on industry best practices and key near-term steps. It is intended to help operators create an actionable transformation strategy.

Course Outline

Day 1

The Future X Network Vision

  • Review the digital pyramid of human needs. Explain the value of time: of saving and generating time.
  • Explore the 100 years, 100x shift in network architecture.
  • Explore the evolution of productivity gains as a result of technology evolutions. Discuss the emerging need to connect everything.
  • Introduce the five megatrends in the industry and discuss their implication for services and traffic.
  • Explain the Future X network: cognitive, converged and cloud-optimized.

Basics of Massive Scale Access – enabled through 5G and leading fixed technologies

  • Articulate the basics of 5G including drivers, requirements, capabilities, and standards status.
  • Introduce the nature of use cases and applications that are enabled by 5G including potential market opportunity.
  • Share global and regional trends for 5G introduction including Service Providers strategies, spectrum planning, ecosystem readiness, and deployment roadmap.
  • Introduce the concept of medium-agnostic self-scaling access; discuss emerging standards such as Future PON, XG.fast and XG.cable/Full Duplex DOCSIS®.

Use Case Analysis

  • Introduce and apply the Bell Labs framework for use case analysis and prioritization considering technical feasibility and business potential.
  • Identify and prioritize use cases relevant for Service Providers business and technological context.
  • Examine the network requirements for a representative set of leading 5G access use cases.
  • Explore the additional opportunities provided by massive scale access, that also includes the latest fixed access and Wi-Fi technologies.

Target 5G Network Architecture

  • Examine the high-level impact of 5G use cases on Service Providers network and operations, including limitations of current assets.
  • Study end-to-end network dimensioning needed to realize the representative set of 5G use cases for RAN, transport, and mobile core.
  • Analyze the technology enablers required to satisfy the technical requirements of 5G use cases.
  • Identify the target 5G network architecture needed to realize the 5G use cases leveraging the required technology enablers.
  • Describe how 5G will tie-in with fixed network architectures to create medium-agnostic self-scaling access functionality.
  • Understand how an unlicensed and shared spectrum regime augments service providers spectrum and technology strategy
  • Explore how continuously evolving Wi-Fi technologies enhance 5G network architectures.

 

Day 2

Transformation Roadmap

  • Explore the network and operations transformation approaches being adopted with 5G as the goal.
  • Understand the drivers and criteria for virtualization, distribution and centralization of network functions in the RAN and mobile core.
  • Analyze the strategy for 5G spectrum acquisition, site build-out for radio access, edge and centralized data centers, and deep-fiber penetration for backhaul and fronthaul networks.
  • Examine 5G deployment options considering evolution of LTE RAN and EPC; analyze non-standalone vs. standalone deployment options.
  • Identify the value proposition of the 5G next-generation core and network slicing.
  • Discuss when and where to integrate both 5G and fixed access technology as part of a medium-agnostic self-scaling access solution.
  • Explore the near term no regret steps that should be taken on the road to massive scale access.

Business Models and Value Creation

  • Analyze new services and the market opportunity enabled by 5G and other Massive Scale Access technologies, with focus on the Service Providers value creation and role in the value chain.
  • Explore the opportunities, challenges, and competitive threats Service Providers are likely to encounter in the process. Analyze how operators can leverage their strengths, overcome weaknesses, and consider partnerships to maximize their value capture.
  • Examine cost efficiencies of 5G technology in offering mobile broadband services as compared to legacy technologies and their evolutions.

Go-to-Market Plan

  • Introduce and apply the Bell Labs business model framework to identify go-to-market strategies.
  • Examine key partnerships and business models to bring to market new services that leverage Massive Scale Access technologies, both 5G and fixed access.
  • Identify key next steps for transformation of mobile and fixed networks to take full advantage of Massive Scale Access technologies.

Title: Bell Labs Future X Workshop: Converged Edge Cloud
Description:
We are entering an era where potentially 100x capacity is required. This will entail a new approach to networking by exploring new architectural dimensions. One of these dimensions is embedding the cloud in the network to form a new converged edge cloud to provide the optimum performance (throughput and latency) and economics for both virtualized networking functions and any other performance-critical enterprise or web service.

Among the myriad business opportunities that can be unearthed by the converged edge cloud, there are initial questions any operator faces. “What does converged edge cloud mean in my specific context?”, “What services can I offer leveraging converged edge cloud that I cannot offer today or in the near future?”, “How can I make money and build a business out of it?”

This workshop addresses the business, technology, architecture, and operations pillars for a successful converged edge cloud implementation, and provides a global perspective of emerging trends, industry best practices and key near-term steps. It is intended to help service providers create an actionable transformation strategy to adopt converged edge cloud.

Course Outline

Day 1

The Future X Network Vision

  • Review the digital pyramid of human needs. Explain the value of time: of saving and generating time.
  • Explore the 100 years, 100x shift in network architecture.
  • Explore the evolution of productivity gains as a result of technology evolutions. Discuss the emerging need to connect everything.
  • Introduce the five megatrends in the industry and discuss their implication for services and traffic.
  • Explain the Future X network: cognitive, converged and cloud-optimized.

Basics of converged edge cloud

  • Articulate the basics of a converged edge cloud architecture including drivers, requirements, capabilities.
  • Introduce the nature of use cases and applications that are enabled by a converged edge cloud architecture, including potential market opportunity for Ultra-Reliable Low-Latency Communications (URLLC) applications.
  • Share global and regional trends for converged edge cloud implementation, including service providers strategies, ecosystem readiness, and deployment roadmap.
  • Introduce Central Offices re-architected as Data Centers (CORD).
  • Introduce the key security considerations needed for converged edge cloud.

Use Case Analysis

  • Introduce and apply the Bell Labs framework for use case analysis and prioritization considering technical feasibility and business potential.
  • Identify and prioritize use cases relevant for Service Providers business and technological context.
  • Examine the network requirements for a representative set of leading URLLC use cases.
  • Explore the additional opportunities the converge edge cloud may create in partnership with global cloud providers.

Target converged edge cloud architecture

  • Examine the high-level impact of URLLC use cases on service providers network and operations, including limitations of current assets.
  • Understand service provider options for achieving optimized: IP/Ethernet/Optical fabric, Edge cloud datacenter hardware, Edge cloud automation, Edge cloud-native software
  • Study end-to-end network dimensioning needed to realize the representative set of URLLC use cases for access, transport, platforms and core.
  • Analyze the technology enablers required to satisfy the technical requirements of URLLC use cases.
  • Identify the target converged edge cloud architecture needed to realize the leading URLLC use cases leveraging the required technology enablers.

 

Day 2

Transformation roadmap

  • Understand the drivers and criteria for virtualization, distribution and centralization of network functions in the access, transport, platforms and core domains.
  • Examine the maturity level and vendor ecosystem for the main components of a converged edge cloud architecture.
  • Explore the network & operations transformation approaches and degree of implementation of converged edge cloud for a representative range of operators.
  • Explore the required organizational changes needed for the future automated operations required by converged edge cloud.
  • Explore the near-term no regret moves that should be taken on the road to converged edge cloud.

End-to-end security in a converged edge cloud environment

  • Discuss new security threats introduced by edge cloud, virtualization, NFV and SDN, at the network and device levels.
  • Understand how threat and vulnerability is managed in an NFV and SDN-enabled environment.
  • Understand how micro-segmentation augments datacenter security.
  • Explore how analytics are used to mitigate threats.
  • Evaluate the return on investment in security measures.

Business models & value creation

  • Analyze new services and the market opportunity enabled by a converged edge cloud architecture, with focus on the service providers value creation and role in the value chain.
  • Examine TCO efficiencies on current network spend enabled by a converged edge cloud architecture (CO consolidation, VNF placement optimization).
  • Explore the opportunities, challenges, and competitive threats service providers are likely to encounter in the process. Analyze how operators can leverage their strengths, overcome weaknesses, and consider partnerships to maximize their value capture.

Go-to-market plan

  • Present key operator positioning strategies in the virtual cloud-based world: global service provider vs. local access carrier.
  • Explore the formation of global-local alliance framework that connects and interworks local and global service providers (similar to that of the airline industry).
  • Examine key partnerships and business models to bring to market new services that leverage converged edge cloud.
  • Introduce and apply the Bell Labs business model framework to define a go-to-market roadmap for new initiatives: New services and revenue (5G era URLLC applications), Network cost efficiencies (CO consolidation, VNF optimized placement), Operations & systems/OSS, and Partnership programs

Title: Bell Labs Future X Workshop: Future X Overview
Description:
We are at the dawn of a new era of human existence that will be shaped by digitisation with the goal of automating much of our life and augmenting our intelligence, effectively creating time.

Operators are being challenged to look beyond their traditional strengths, in order to successfully transform and become key players in this new digital era. This will require leveraging and monetizing innovative technologies such as 5G, cloud, IP/Optical, Internet of Things and data analytics.

The Future X Overview workshop examines the current and forthcoming breakthroughs in these technologies at both the architectural and systems levels, which forms the basis for discussion of the critical business issues that need to be considered today.

It discusses practical insights, industry trends and near-term applications relevant for the telecommunications industry. It incorporates select elements from the five associated domain-focused workshops in the series.

Course Outline

The Future X Network Vision

  • Explain the value of time: of saving and generating time.
  • Review the digital pyramid of human needs.
  • Explore the evolution of productivity gains as a result of technology evolutions.
  • Introduce the eight value vectors of Future X networks and operations.

Market and Business drivers

  • Highlight the evolution of customer demand. Elaborate on current end user desires - life style shift, enriched communication, video and gaming experience.
  • Elaborate on evolving Industry desires - automation, robotics, and Industry 4.0.
  • Introduce the six mega-trends in the industry
  • Discuss the emerging need to connect everything and the value of cognition and context.
  • Explore and emphasise the need for inherent security and privacy.
  • Emphasise the importance of managing tangible and intangible assets on the balance sheet and how to conduct business beyond service provider’s network
  • Discuss how the market is being created and evolved

Services Evolution

  • Discuss the evolution of services and their impact on traffic growth and predictability.
  • Emphasise the significance of latency-critical services and the business value of cloudification.
  • Explain how growing processing needs are driving new architectural requirements (the laws of physics).
  • Address hybrid and converged edge cloud services needs.
  • Explain how to enable the zero-marginal cost strategy with emphasis on the zero-touch operation model.

Technology & Operations Evolution

  • Explore the 100-year, 100x shift in network architecture.
  • Examine massive scale access and the continuing march toward long-wires / short-wireless.
  • Discuss the need for processing power at the edge, optimising for converged edge cloud network functionality, and distributed data centres.
  • Examine the evolution of IP and Optical to a smart network fabric.
  • Emphasise the importance of security and privacy by design.
  • Explore the advancement of augmented cognition systems and digital value platforms as needed for new IoT services.
  • Explain the evolution toward zero-touch and predictive operations utilising data analytics and automation.

Focus on Massive Scale Access

  • Discuss the concept of universal access.

  • Understand the vision of the long-wires short-wireless principle.

  • Explore how wireless and fixed access technologies will evolve.

  • Explore the new types of service offerings.

  • Discuss the key 5G and fixed technology enablers.

  • Discuss how network slicing and end-to-end programmability is being brought to life.

  • Examine new spectrum strategies.

Focus on Converged Edge Cloud

  • Understand deep fibre and the essential converged cloud edge.

  • Discuss how to realise value using new value levers.

  • Examine the new business models; explore which may prove right.

  • Understand operations cost savings

Focus on Smart Network Fabric

  • Discuss the vision for an integrated network operating system.
  • Understand the advancement of NetUNIX.
  • Explore resiliency concepts and IP/optical integration.

Focus on Digital Value Platforms

  • Examine the connection of everything.
  • Examine the automation of everything.
  • Explore strategies for creating value with platforms.

Note: the course outline is flexible, and can be adapted on special demand

Title: CFX-5000 17.5 - IMS (IP Multimedia Subsystem) System Administration Curriculum
Description:
Curriculum Contents

CN37350-D-1000 Introduction to Nokia IMS Solution (22 mins.) – optional

• Describe the Nokia IMS solution architecture and components

CN37531-D-1751 Administration Interfaces for CFX-5000 (1 hr. 12 mins.)

• Describe the administration interfaces

• Perform configuration management using NetAct and OM Agent

• Perform fault management using NetAct and OM Agent

CN37532-D-1751 CFX-5000 Hardware Platforms (15 mins.)

• Describe the ATCA hardware

• Describe the HP hardware

• Describe the Nokia Airframe hardware used by Cloudband

CN3734-D-170 CFX-5000/CMS-8200 IMS 17.0 Functional Delta on Bare Metal to Cloud (2 hrs.) optional

• Describe the virtualized CFX-5000 (CSCF)

• Describe the virtualized CMS-8200 (HSS-FE)

• Describe the virtualized CMS-8200 (DRA)

• Describe the operational differences between IMS on ATCA, IMS on HP and IMS in the Cloud

CN37533-D-1751 CFX-5000 Registration (1 hr. 48 mins.)

• Describe subscriber registration from LTE access networks and from the Wi-Fi area

• Explain various types of authentication procedures

• Set parameters for registration-related scenarios via NetAct

• Set parameters for roaming policy control on P-CSCF, I-CSCF and HSS via NetAct

CN37534-D-1751 CFX-5000 Session Handling and Routing (1 hr. 12 mins.)

• Describe message flows for session handling and routing

• Set parameters for session handling in IMS

• Describe supplementary services via application servers

• Set emergency call parameters

• Describe resource management for application servers

• Perform node monitoring

CN37535-D-1751 CFX-5000 Interface to IP Connectivity Networks (Gm Interface) (42 mins.)

• Configure GM interface for IP connectivity

• Perform PCRF administration in IMS

• Perform SBC administration in IMS

CN37536-D-1751 CFX-5000 Session Handling for I-SBC (1 hr. 20 mins.)

• Configure registration and session handling parameters for roaming

• Configure optimal media routing parameters

• Configure optimized bearer path

• Configure message manipulation

CN37537-D-1751 CFX-5000 Session Handling for SRVCC and eSRVCC  (42 mins.)

• Describe registration handling and session anchoring for VCC

• Describe transcoding after eSRVCC

• Configure parameters for domain transfer from LTE to CS

CN37538-D-1751 CFX-5000 Charging (1hr. 20 mins.)

• Describe offline charging in IMS

• Configure offline charging parameters

• Describe online charging in IMS

• Configure online charging parameters

Audience

This training is designed for persons who need to operate and maintain the CFX-5000.

Title: CFX-5000/CMS-8200 IMS (IP Multimedia Subsystem) 17.0 Troubleshooting
Description:
Upon completion of this course, the student will be able to troubleshoot CFX-5000 and CMS-8200 on bare metal (ATCA/HP) and Cloud (VMware and CloudBand).

Course Content Topics

Introduction to the Nokia IMS solution

• Describe the 3GPP IMS network architecture

• Specify the Nokia products to realize the Nokia IMS solution

• Describe the ATCA and HP-based bare metal IMS architecture

• Describe the VMware and CloudBand virtualized IMS architecture

OAM Interfaces, Usage of cmcli and TSP WEB GUI

• Briefly describe the OAM Interfaces

• Use the Configuration Management Command line Interface tool (cmcli)

• Connect to TSP WEB GUI and use the appropriate management functions

• Perform fault management and internal trace

• Check counter values

• Check processes and subsystems

Diagnostic tools

• Specify diagnostic tools that can be used to troubleshoot IMS (e.g. RapidStat, RtpDumpLog, …)

• Practice the use of the existing diagnostic tools to collect diagnostic data

Basic System Check

• Perform basic system checks

• Practice the use of the correct tools (e.g. Alarm Checks, netstat, …) and procedures.

Symptom Collection

• Perform symptom collection by applying the learned procedures and diagnostic tools.

• Practice network packet capturing (e.g. by using snoop and tcpdump) and analysis with

Wireshark tool.

• Describe how Load balancer logging is performed

• Describe IP plumbing

Case-Based Troubleshooting

• Recognize successful and unsuccessful IMS registration

• Recognize connection problems

• Recognize other problems, like missing domain, realm, PCRF problem, …

• Execute for the above-mentioned cases the troubleshooting procedures and find the root cause

• Apply the solutions for the above recognized root causes.

Title: 7705 Product Overview | TOS36084WK
Description:
The curriculum is designed to help system planners, installers and commissioning engineers become familiar with the components and architecture of the SAR 7705 family of products, to gain an understanding of the features and characteristics of the hardware and software, and to learn about how the 7705 SAR is deployed in the aggregation and backhaul segments of a converged network.

As an alternative, learners wishing to focus on a subset of the 7705 SAR product suite might consider the following courses:

7705 SAR (Service Aggregation Router) Modular Chassis Product Overview | ER00573-W-1700 (includes SAR-8/ -18) or,

7750 SAR (Service Aggregation Router) Platform Chassis Product Overview | ER00574-W-1700 (all other SAR variants)

Title: 7705 Modular Chassis Product Overview | ER00573-W-1700
Description:
This course focuses on the 7705 SAR Modular Chassis products to help system planners, installers and commissioning engineers become familiar with the components and architecture of the 7705 SAR-18 and SAR-8 products and to gain an understanding of how they are deployed in the aggregation and backhaul segments of a converged network.

NOTE: Refer to7705 SAR (Service Aggregation Router) Product Overview | TER36084WK_v2.0 for training on the complete 7705 SAR product family.

Title: 7705 SAR Platform Chassis Product Overview | ER00574-W-1700

This course focuses on the 7705 SAR platform chassis products to help system planners, installers and commissioning engineers become familiar with the components and architecture of the 7705 SAR platform products and to gain an understanding of how they are deployed in the aggregation and backhaul segments of a converged network.

NOTE: Refer to 7705 SAR (Service Aggregation Router) Product Overview | TER36084WK_v2.0 for training on the complete 7705 SAR product family.

Title: NFM-P Fundamentals | TOS00060WK Curriculum
Description:
This solution is intended to illustrate the structure of the learning included in this curriculum as a guide to tailoring content where a customer wishes to focus on specific topics.

This is a Web-based learning course designed to provide technical personnel and network operators with foundations for using the NFM-P to: perform a variety of tasks, including: network equipment discovery and management; monitoring and supervision; identify alarms declared against equipment and services; obtain details about alarm management and filtering; and, alarm types, severity, status and correlation.

NOTE: This course is relevant for all NFM-P Releases as of Rel. 17.3

Title: Introduction to 5G
Keywords: Keywords: 5G, System, 5G Drivers, 5G Use Cases, 5G RAN, 5G Core, 5G Roadmap
Audience: Introduction to 5G.
Description:
5G is on the horizon. Are you ready?

Future mobile technologies usher in new paradigms for connected society. In the 2020 timeframe and beyond mobile technologies will bring together people along with things, data, applications, transport systems and cities in a smart networked communications ecosystem.

This training focuses on yet-to-be-standardised 5G as it has been developed so far and the areas of technological innovation needed to deliver the 5G vision.

Learn what is driving 5G, the technical performance requirements for the radio systems to support 5G, taking into account the needs of a wide portfolio of future scenarios, and use cases.

Learn what 5G networks will look like, when it will be deployed and how you can prepare for 5G today.
Objectives:
• Describe what makes a 5G System
  • List 5G drivers
  • Identify 5G potential use scenarios
  • Identify 5G System requirements
  • Describe 5G radio access network building blocks
  • Describe 5G Core Network and End to End Architecture
  • List the major 5G ongoing industry activities
  • Explain the roadmap for 5G standards and rollout

Title: 5G End-to-End Sales Certification Level 3
Keywords: Keywords: 5G, 5G Transport, 5G E2E Architecture, 5G Radio, Core evolution to 5G, SDM Evolution to 5G Core, EPC Evolution to 5G Cor, 5G PCF, Network Slicing, 5G Services
Description:
5G will be far more than just a new radio access technology. Its architecture will expand to multiple systems by providing a Next-Generation Core for multiple access technologies, services, and service providers. NFV and SDN technologies will support this transition by allowing systems to use a high level of abstraction.

For 5G, transport will evolve from a static, linear connection to a programmable mesh that dynamically interconnects all mobile and cloud elements.
Objectives:
5G networks will introduce the concept of network slices, which are virtual instances of an entire network. Each slice will be tailored for a specific use case to ensure that end-to-end performance meets customer expectations and service and application requirements.

At test is required to complete the certification.

Title: 5G End-to-End Sales Certification L2
Keywords: Keywords: 5G Market, CI, 5G OBS, 5G Solution, 5G Commercials, 5G Services
Description: 5G is the new generation of radio systems and network architecture delivering extreme broadband and ultra robust, low latency connectivity and massive networking for the Internet of Things to enable the programmable world, which will transform our individual lives, economy and society. What 5G will be good for and what technical requirements that imposes on the network have become quite clear.
Objectives:
The industry has widely adopted Nokia's view that 5G will be about people and things as per the following three use case categories:

1. Massive broadband that delivers gigabytes of bandwidth on demand

2.Critical machine-type communication that allows for the immediate, synchronous eye-hand feedback that enables e.g. remote control over robots

3.Massive machine-type communication that connects billions of sensors and machines 5G

Title: GRTS: Nokia 5G Readiness Services Accelerate Operators Paths to 5G and help to sell cloud transformation
Keywords: Retired in NLDH - I removed it from LS
Description: Lots of buzz about 5G - many options but no clear path. Operators are struggling to see the business value and revenue. How to monetize 5G? How to evolve to it? In reality 5G will not become the reality overnight. The day to start thinking about 5G is today. Essential network prerequisites and business imperatives need to be identified and implemented. With our 5G Readiness Services our customers are able to prepare their business, operations and technologies for the programmable world.
Objectives:
Level 1

Learn more about how to get 5G customer conversations kicked-off today to enable Nokia to win in 5G.
